intro: Isocoma tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant has hairy, gray-green foliage and produces yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in dry grasslands and rocky soils. Isocoma tomentosa is adapted to withstand drought and heat, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
